summary.para: A ColorLUTParams structure contains members (color lookup tables) that specify color adjustments to a bitmap.
You can apply a custom adjustment to a bitmap by following these steps.

item.description: Each member of the ColorLUTParams structure is a color lookup table (array of 256 bytes) for a particular color channel, alpha, red, green, or blue. Assign values of your choice to the four lookup tables.
Pass the address of the ColorLUTParams structure to the method of a ColorLUT object.
Pass the address of the ColorLUT object to the Graphics.DrawImage method or to the method.

member.name: ColorLUTParams.lutB
member.summary: Array of 256 bytes that specifies the adjustment for the blue channel.

member.name: ColorLUTParams.lutG
member.summary: Array of 256 bytes that specifies the adjustment for the green channel.

member.name: ColorLUTParams.lutR
member.summary: Array of 256 bytes that specifies the adjustment for the red channel.

member.name: ColorLUTParams.lutA
member.summary: Array of 256 bytes that specifies the adjustment for the alpha channel.
